title: 'Distressed' woman captured on CCTV being snatched off street and forced into Mercedes
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Chilling footage showing a "distressed" woman being forced into a car by two men has been released by detectives investigating the suspected kidnap.

The clip shows a silver Mercedes pull up on the street in Middlesborough before both of its back doors are opened and the woman is bundled inside.

A man on the driver's side walks around the back of the car to shut the door on the passenger's side before the car speeds off, TeessideLive reports.

Detectives are appealing for information and for any witnesses who may have seen the incident on Wednesday night to come forward.

Police believe a white and black male were in the car.

A statement from Cleveland Police says: "Police are investigating a suspicious incident after a receiving a report at 11.55pm last night alleging that a distressed woman had been forced into the back of a silver Mercedes reg NV56 EXR on Clairville Road in Middlesbrough."

She added: "Detectives are urgently appealing to identify a woman seen on CCTV walking on Egmont Road in Middlesborough at 11.46pm.

"The woman can be seen talking on her phone and walking in the direction of Clairville Road.

"CCTV footage of the woman has been released by police, as they look to identify her to ensure that she is safe and well and rule her out from their inquiries."

A majority of neighbours said they didn't hear or see anything.

One man, who lives at the bottom of the road said he had heard gossip that there had been a “kidnapping” but didn’t hear the actual incident himself.

He did, however, say that he woke up in the middle of the night as he thought he heard someone “trying his door”.

He said he’d been burgled in the past so was wary of that happening again.

Another neighbour said the reason she didn't hear anything may have been down to the fact she sleeps in a room facing the opposite road.

She said that the community around the area were close to each other and that she had great neighbours, many of which appear to be taxi drivers.

Detectives are also keen to speak to the driver of a car which passed the Mercedes as they could be a potential witness.

They are also asking for other drivers in the area to check if they have any useful footage on their dashcams and residents with private CCTV to see if they captured anything.

Anyone with information is asked to call Cleveland Police on the non-emergency number 101 quoting reference 182940 or Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111
description: Detectives from Cleveland Police are investigating the suspected kidnap in Middlesborough last night
